meanings.definition: Having the consistency of a thick liquid.
meanings.sent1: The semifluid mixture slowly oozed out of the container.
meanings.sent2: The semifluid batter was perfect for making pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The semifluid paint seemed to dance on the canvas as the artist worked.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a semifluid river, flowing steadily but with hidden depths.
meanings.sent5: The semifluid lava bubbled and hissed as it flowed down the volcano.

meanings.definition: A substance that is neither completely solid nor completely liquid.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the semifluid to understand its unique properties.
meanings.sent2: The semifluid in the container sloshed around as he moved it.
meanings.sent3: The chef struggled to contain the semifluid sauce in the pan.
meanings.sent4: The semifluid of the glacier seemed to defy the laws of nature.
meanings.sent5: The semifluid of the quicksand trapped the adventurer in its grasp.
